q:
If the following is an HTML snippet, what would be the correct angular script to display an alert on the browser when the button is clicked?
Code

 <body ng-app="myApp" >
 <div ng-controller="app">
 <button><a href="" ng-click="alert()">Click Here</a></button>
 </div> 
 </body>

Options

1.

<script>
 var app = angular.controller("app", []);
 app.controller(['$scope', function ($app) {
 $app.alert = function () {
 $scope.alert("Some Text!");
 }
 }]);
 </script>

2.

<script>
 var app = angular.module("myApp", []);
 app.controller(“app”, ['$app', function ($app) {
 $app.alert = function () {
 $app.alert("Some Text!");
 }
 }]);
 </script>

3.

<script>
 var app = angular.module("myApp", []);
 app.controller(“app”, ['$scope', function ($app) {
 $app.alert = function () {
 alert("Some Text!");
 }
 }]);
 </script>

 

4.

<script>
 var app = angular.module("app", []);
 app.controller(“app”, function ($scope) {
 $scope.alert = function () {
 alert("Some Text!");
 }
 }]);
 </script>

You have an AngularJS application and in that, you want to show the coordinates of the mouse pointer when hovered over a particular text. The HTML snippet for the text is:

<h1 ng-mousemove="myFunction($event)">Some text!</h1>

Rule
    1. The coordinates should change when you hover the mouse over the text only.
    2. If the mouse has hovered somewhere outside the text, the coordinates of the last mouse pointer over the text should be displayed.
You need to write the angular script to implement the functionality that follows the rules. Which of the following is the correct way to implement it?

Options

1

<script>
 var app = angular.module('myApplication', []);
 app.controller('myController', function($scope) {
 $scope.myFunction = function(myEvent) {
 $scope.xCoordinate = myEvent.clientX;
 $scope.yCoordinate = myEvent.clientY;
 }
 });
 </script>

2

<script>
 var app = angular.module('myApplication', []);
 app.controller('myController', function(myEvent) {
 myEvent.xCoordinate = myEvent.clientX;
 myEvent.yCoordinate = myEvent.clientY;
 });
 </script>

3

<script>
 angular.controller('myController', function($scope) {
 $scope.myFunction = function(myEvent) {
 myEvent.xCoordinate = myEvent.clientX;
 myEvent.yCoordinate = myEvent.clientY;
 }
 });
 </script>

4

<script>
 var app = angular.module('myApplication', []);
 app.controller('myController', myFunction = function($myEvent) {
 $app.xCoordinate = myEvent.clientX;
 $app.yCoordinate = myEvent.clientY;
 });
 </script>

We use data binding to synchronize between the model and the view. The changes in the model affect the view along with updating the models as well. It has a total of 3 lines missing named Line1, Line2, Line 3. Choose the appropriate option to replace the missing lines.
Code

Var test_app = angular.module("test_app", []);
 Line1
 
 Line2

 $scope.output = testService.square($scope.number);
 $scope.operation = function() {
 $scope.output = testService.operation($scope.number);
 }
 });

Options

1.

<div controller = “test_ctrl”>
 var app = angular.module(TEST_APP, []);
 app.controller(function($scope) {

2.

<div controller = “test_ctrl”, $scope>
 var app = angular.module(TEST_APP, []);
 app.controller(function(test_id) {

3.

<div ng-app="TEST_APP" ng-controller="test_ctrl">
 var app = angular.module('TEST_APP', []);
 app.controller('test_ctrl', function($scope) {

4.

<div app="TEST_APP" controller="test_ctrl">
 var app = angular.module('TEST_APP', []);
 app.controller(function($scope) {

You have made an Angular app. You have written the code given alongside to print the first name and the last name of a person.
Select a code-snippet from the following options, which does the same work as the code-snippet in the code section, but uses controller methods.

code:

<div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="myCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{firstName + " " + lastName}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
 $scope.firstName = "John";
 $scope.lastName = "Doe";
});
</script>

options:

  1. <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{fullName()}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('myCtrl', function($scope) {
 $scope.firstName = "John";
 $scope.lastName = "Doe";
 $scope.fullName = function() {
 return $scope.firstName + " " + $scope.lastName;
 };
});
</script>

     

  2. <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{fullName()}}

</div>

<body>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('personCtrl', function($scope) {
 $scope.firstName = "John";
 $scope.lastName = "Doe";
 $scope.fullName = function() {
 return $scope.firstName + " " + $scope.lastName;
 };
});
</body>

     

  3. <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{fullName()}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('personCtrl', function($scope) {
 $scope.firstName = "John";
 $scope.lastName = "Doe";
 $scope.fullName = function() {
 return $scope.firstName + " " + $scope.lastName;
 };
});
</script>

     

  4. <div ng-app="myApp" ng-controller="personCtrl">

First Name: <input type="text" ng-model="firstName"><br>
Last Name: <input type="text" ng-model="lastName"><br>
<br>
Full Name: {{fullName()}}

</div>

<script>
var app = angular.module('myApp', []);
app.controller('personCtrl', function($scope) {
 $scope.firstName = "John";
 $scope.lastName = "Doe";
 $scope.fullName = function() =>{
 return $scope.firstName + " " + $scope.lastName;
 };
});
</script>

Alice is working on the controllers from Laravel Framework for her web application. If she is required to create a controller named MyController such that it will make a plain constructor, then which of the following PHP commands can she perform in this scenario:

Commands

1.

php artisan make:controller MyController --plain

2.

php artisan make:controller <MyController> --plain

3.

php artisan make:controller <controller> --plain

4.

php artisan make:controller controller --plain
